name: De-Miner
description:
A small game made with SFML and C++ that works on Android. Has a few dozen levels and some fancy transition effects. As of writing this, all assets were made by me. 

How to play:

In each row and column of the level, there is a single (or multiple) number(s). These represent how many tiles are connected in a column or row. If there are multiple numbers specified for a column or row then that means that there are multiple groups of connected tiles separated by at least one space.

In normal (non-reversed) controls:

  • tap to place the tile
  • hold to mark a spot as a non-tile
